notes: First Mitsubishi-branded sedan sold in North America. Compact FWD sedan. Timing belt maintenance required. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Tredia article, January 17, 2025 revision.
Compact sport coupe. Turbocharged variant available. Timing belt maintenance critical, especially on turbo models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Cordia article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Rear-wheel drive turbocharged sport coupe. Intercooled turbo versions produced 188 hp. Timing belt maintenance critical. Turbocharger servicing requires attention to oil quality and cooling system. Also sold as Chrysler Conquest and Dodge Conquest. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Starion article, January 17, 2025 revision.
Fourth generation midsize sedan introduced to North American market. Timing belt maintenance required. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Galant article, January 17, 2025 revision.
Fifth generation introduced late 1988 for 1989 model year. Timing belt maintenance required. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Galant article, January 17, 2025 revision.

Compact pickup truck (L200/Triton internationally). Diesel variant available 1983-1985. Timing belt maintenance required on all engines. Diesel service requires specialized knowledge and glow plug maintenance. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Triton article, January 17, 2025 revision.

First generation compact/midsize SUV (Pajero internationally). Turbodiesel available 1983-1986. Part-time 4WD with lockable hubs. Timing belt maintenance required on all engines. Diesel variants require specialized service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Pajero article, January 17, 2025 revision.
Third generation subcompact. Turbocharged variant available on certain trims. Timing belt maintenance required. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Mirage article, January 17, 2025 revision.
Rebadged Hyundai Excel. Entry-level subcompact hatchback. Timing belt maintenance required. Data sourced from Wikipedia Hyundai Excel article, January 17, 2025 revision.
Cab-over van design. Available with 4WD. Timing belt maintenance required. Data sourced from Wikipedia Mitsubishi Delica article, January 17, 2025 revision.
